content.question: Light incident on a single slit forms an interference pattern on a distant screen. Each point on the wave front moving through the slit acts like a point source. The crests and troughs for waves originating from two points, <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, are shown by solid and dashed lines, respectively. Which of the following statements about the diagram is true?

choices.label: Destructive interference will occur at point <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Constructive interference will occur at point <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

A bright fringe will be formed at point <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="bold"><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> on the screen.
A dark fringe will be formed at point <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> on the screen.

content.answer: A dark fringe will be formed at point <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> on the screen.
